Begin Tape 472, Side A.] HEBERT: Okay. So you had a marvelous time at LSU? HAMILTON: I mean, I had a marvelous time, despite the problems. HEBERT: Well, last time you mentioned that it wasn't all bad, and . . . HAMILTON: Well, it wasn't. I mean, I had a marvelous time. I mean, clearly, I had some bad times, but I met some interesting and wonderful people. People who are my friends today. I learned a great deal about life and about myself, which I think the college experience is supposed to give you. I mean, I'm more concerned that the university, from where I sit today, has not progressed far enough beyond where it was then, than I am that I did not get enough from the university experience. I got a significant amount from it and, I mean, I'd do it again. No question about it. HEBERT: Well, that's about all I had to cover. Is there anything that I've left out that you'd like to talk about? Have I left out anything about your LSU experience, or . . . HAMILTON: No. HEBERT: Okay. HAMILTON: No. [End Tape 472, Side A. extension.transcript: Narrator: Leo Hamilton 4700.0322 Interviewer: Mary Hebert Session II Transcriber: Robin Cate 11 September 1993 [End Tape 471, Side B. Begin Tape 472, Side A.] HEBERT: Okay. So you had a marvelous time at LSU? HAMILTON: I mean, I had a marvelous time, despite the problems. HEBERT: Well, last time you mentioned that it wasn't all bad, and . . . HAMILTON: Well, it wasn't. I mean, I had a marvelous time. I mean, clearly, I had some bad times, but I met some interesting and wonderful people. People who are my friends today. I learned a great deal about life and about myself, which I think the college experience is supposed to give you. I mean, I'm more concerned that the university, from where I sit today, has not progressed far enough beyond where it was then, than I am that I did not get enough from the university experience. I got a significant amount from it and, I mean, I'd do it again. No question about it. HEBERT: Well, that's about all I had to cover. Is there anything that I've left out that you'd like to talk about? Have I left out anything about your LSU experience, or . . . HAMILTON: No. HEBERT: Okay. HAMILTON: No. [End Tape 472, Side A. End Session II.]
